website_summaries.verdict: The best choice if you're looking for an option that kills broadleaf weeds. Great value for the money.
pros: Kills broadleaf weeds such as dandelions, chickweed, and poison ivy without harming grass
2 - 3 tablespoons treats up to 1,000 square feet
cons: Not recommended for use on windy days, as it can drift and damage delicate plants
Chemical odor is strong and may linger for a few days

customer_reviews.title: Works great but takes about 2 weeks to see full effect.
customer_reviews.text: Works great (BUT be patient). As you can see, my lawn was overrun by weeds. After aerating, I sprayed this on my 1 1/2 acre lawn using 1.5 is per gallon (used ortho garden sprayer). Took about 2 weeks to see full results but this killed dandelions, clover, hawkweed, plantain and crabgrass (even though commenters said it wouldn't kill crabgrass). This product did NOT kill wild strawberry though. See picture of 2 week results
customer_reviews.author: Christina Darveau

customer_reviews.title: Working so far.
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t used yet. Wanted to add pictures of bottle. Update: day 3 and the weeds I sprayed look wilted and are starting to brown. I have a large variety of weeds I sprayed so this will be a good test of this spray. I mixed 1.5 oz of 2, 4-d and 1.5 oz of dish soap into my 1 gallon hand sprayer with water. The instructions were not very clear on the quantities.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff, works and WILL buy again
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works, just look at the picture, I sprayed next to the house, but not out back.. Speaks for itself
customer_reviews.author: J. Maynard

customer_reviews.title: Killed the weeds as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Living in a rural area with a 2 acre lawn, weeks and goat head stickers are a constant problem. One application of 2,4-D killed all the weeds, clovers, and goat head stickers within two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: G. K. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Have Ordered This Product Several Times for Common Florida Weeks
customer_reviews.text: Product works great getting rid of common weeds. Just make sure it's diluted properly. It does seems to temporarily stunt St. Augustine (as expected) and slows Bermuda but I've always seen recovery after.
customer_reviews.author: PH_Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Works very well!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried all the branded junk in the home stores. I live in Florida so it's a constant challenge. This is the only one that really works! There's enough in this bottle to last a suburbanite for years of nice lawn.
customer_reviews.author: YoJo

customer_reviews.title: I was worried about this, but I saw results ...
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about this, but I saw results 2 days after first treatment. Will definitely repurchase in the future! Edit: Be careful. My first bottle worked fine without killing the grass, the second bottle I got killed EVERYTHING including the grass. Now I have patches everywhere of dead grass.... I don't know what was wrong with the second bottle but it's very upsetting.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Wu

customer_reviews.title: Weed be gone
customer_reviews.text: Did everything to get rid of my weeds including fancy gadgets and also on my knees all day pulling them up from the root. Nothing worked until this product and now the neighbors want to know how i got rid of all my weeds. Part of me wants to tell them, the other part wants me to see them on their knees all day too. lol
customer_reviews.author: The Man

customer_reviews.title: missing directions for hose end sprayer not included. I ...
customer_reviews.text: missing directions for hose end sprayer not included. I had to find it on LAWNSITE.COM. It killed some weeds but not all. it did not burn my lawn either. Next time, I will up the concentration. chose 5 tbsps./ gallon for residential lawn in mid-Atlantic region. DISCLAIMER: You should research your lawn, weeds, etc.. and determine appropriate concentration for needs and desired results.
customer_reviews.author: Cara K.

customer_reviews.title: Clover be-gone!
customer_reviews.text: I had excessive clover growth in my yard. I spent one evening spraying my yard, and about two days later it was all gone. Best part is that it hasn't come back and it's been about a month! I have an acre lot, and used about 1/3 of this container to treat the area. Loved seeing quick results with an easy to use product.
customer_reviews.author: staceym

customer_reviews.title: High Percentage Product: Use a little liquid detergent in the sprayer, and see results.
customer_reviews.text: This product has a higher percentage of chemical than other options (triple some others). No matter what product, if used on waxy leaves of many weeds, it will simply run off. So use a teaspoon per gallon of detergent (add it at the end or you have lots of foam). That increases the effectiveness. I apply late morning to avoid dewy rinse-off. Works somewhat on invasive Nandina, other round-leafed weeds, but seems to only control young violets - perhaps if I treat twice within a couple of days it would knock violets back too.
customer_reviews.author: Jet Jona

customer_reviews.title: My friends told me to "work on those weeds"
customer_reviews.text: My weed and feed pellets ended up in disaster. I literally burned a pathway in my yard. Thank God I have a great sense of humor because we are still laughing about the damage. 24D helped me get the lawn I needed. This year, my yard is looking great. Easy to use. A little expensive on the site. Cheaper places to buy near me.
customer_reviews.author: jeanineb

customer_reviews.title: Worthless.... kills nothing
customer_reviews.text: Worthless..... followed directions on first batch in 4 gallon sprayer.... killed nothing. Mixed 3 times the amount recommended and sprayed it all in less than a 1000sqft area.... maybe 500sqft... killed nothing. I would not recommend this to anyone. Not sure how others get results.... I have effectively destroyed all crabgrass which is supposed to be “impossible” to kill. Buy quinclorac, product called DriveXlR8..... With that said, I am a pro at killing crabgrass which most people fail on.... killing spurweed and clovers should have happened with 2-4d product. I will be buying a different brand, and ensuring it’s a 3 way with 2-4d, dicamba, and MCPP...
customer_reviews.author: Mama

customer_reviews.title: DIY weed killin' at its finest!
customer_reviews.text: Why buy the expensive pre-made stuff when you can get a far better value by doing it yourself! I mixed 2 fluid ounces of the chemical in 1 gallon on water, along with 2 oz of non-ionic surfactant (same manufacturer) and within about 2 weeks after spraying the weeds have curled up and are dead. I might try going 2.5-3oz on some test sections of my lawn and see how it goes as it did take a bit longer than expected to kill them completely. Perhaps the larger dose will work faster? Regardless, this container will last a LONG time for my typical residential usage. Use eye protection and gloves as you would with any chemical! Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: R. Rubin

customer_reviews.title: It works and fast
customer_reviews.text: This product works faster than anything I've ever used. I will continue to buy it and am glad it was suggested to me. Here is my concern though: I wore gloves yet some of this product got on my hands. It ate the skin off my hands and my hands were raw and extremely uncomfortable for over two weeks. I tried lotion and even oil yet nothing hydrated my skin until the skin it killed fell off and new skin grew from underneath. I now know to be more careful. User error. Extremely strong product.
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: Very good late Fall and early Spring weed prevention product.
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my heavily sprinkled broad leaf and chickweed impregnated lawn this spring. It was an abnormally wet spring. The broad leaf weeds browned and dried up immediately but the chickweed seemed to regress in growth only to return later when all the grasses began to green up and grow. Since weeds are tenacious in my northern Georgia area, The spring and fall application of this weed killer has to be a bi-annual application. (As recommended by this manufacture's literature) This product has definitely given my grass a head start and had drastically reduced the weed infestation. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill. Maybach

customer_reviews.title: A little goes a long way
customer_reviews.text: At first I was disappointed a such a small bottled. I admit I didn't read the product details that closely. I was just used to dealing with large bottles and bags from store. We were dealing with clover and unkempt neighboring yards. We used this to help clear our clover and on the neighbor's yard to help keep it back. It works very fast. Stay on it but I definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: goodnitesaigon

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed in your Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 2,4-D Amine Weed Killer after quite a bit of research and it didn't work!! We removed our pool last year late September- Early October. This year we had "Millions of Canadian Thistles" popping up all over a sandy pool area. I dowsed the whole quart with of 2,4-D Weed Killer in that pool area and grass then, used a 1/4 cup or less of "Round Up" with water in a spray bottle on the rocks near my driveway. Well, obviously I need to go purchase more "Round Up" because it killed the Thistle Dead!! Very Disappointed in your Product!! *Photo's Attached
customer_reviews.author: Linda K Zebrowski

customer_reviews.title: Finally, weed free
customer_reviews.text: Made my lawn weed free for the first time in years. I used a hose end sprayer which covered about 2000 sq/ft when walking briskly (just enough to wet the weeds) I used 6 oz. 2,4-D in 11 oz. of water in a hose end sprayer. I premixed enough to fill a two litre bottle at a rate of 6 oz. per 11 ounces of water. I also added about two ounces of Dawn to help the liquid stick to the weeds. This made it convenient to fill the sprayer bottle each time it started running low. This killed all of my weeds in about 7 to 10 days.
customer_reviews.author: WJH

customer_reviews.title: Quick and effective.
customer_reviews.text: Hate using poison, but these darn weeds won't die and they are taking over. 2,4-D works better than any other weed killer. GOOD BY, ROUNDUP,
customer_reviews.author: Val Prestidge

customer_reviews.title: Not great. Go with the proven stuff.
customer_reviews.text: Did not work that great. I was hoping for something more like RoundUp but as I should've known, nothing is quite like it. I'll just mix this in with some RoundUp in the future just to use it up.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Z

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t kill my Dallas grass
customer_reviews.text: I usually use MSMA on my yard to control broadleaf weeds and 2-4-D was recommended by a friend. I mixed it with water at the rate recommended and have sprayed the yard twice in 6 weeks. The Dallas grass and crabgrass will turn a little yellow but not die. About 2 weeks ago I mixed some more at double the rate and sprayed a different area and it didn’t do much better.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Not working
customer_reviews.text: I had invasion of dollar weed in my lawn. The dose that was recommended was not working for me. I increase three times but still, all the weeks came back soon. It did damage my grass too. it just kills the leaf, not the root it claimed. Expect a boom of crabgrass if you don't add any product for killing crabgrass with this.
customer_reviews.author: Shaik

customer_reviews.title: Works but tricky to figure out dilution
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to work pretty good for me on dandelions and worked real well on clover. Took a little while to do the math to figure out how to dilute it but I mixed up a batch in an old roundup bottle and used just as a spot treatment. Didn’t appear to harm grass initially but now a few months later I do have some brown patches that won’t go away no matter how much I water. Not sure if that’s related or not. Bottle will Last forever the way I’m using it as I don’t treat my whole yard so more economical than the ready to use round up Sprays etc.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M

customer_reviews.title: This is a grass killer
customer_reviews.text: The product name is: 2, 4-D. 2, 4-D is a broadleaf killer and not a grassy killer. This product killer my St. Augustine Grass and did not do much to kill the clover (a broadleaf weed). I'm still looking for a weed killer with ONLY 2,4-D
customer_reviews.author: Rick W.

customer_reviews.title: Be Patient, Follow Directions, it Works
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is the real deal. Bought a house with an awful "lawn". Have been redoing the lawn in sections. Start with this, making sure it isn't going to rain for several days. Then, let it work. Will take over a week for some types of weeds, but eventually, they will die magically! Then, rake out the dead weeds, drop some fertilizer, and seed. Whallah, you will have a great looking lawn in no time. Couldn't do it without this stuff though. The branded stuff from big box stores is a waste of money. Buy a backpack sprayer if you have a big lawn like me, and use this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Fitz

customer_reviews.title: it worked for my weeds
customer_reviews.text: This stuff worked better than the Tenacity I purchased and used a couple of times to kill clover and other broadleaf weeds in my KB lawn. I think I used a little too much because some desirable grass did die. I'm not mad about it and don't blame the product because I know during the time of mixing and spraying I was on a mission to kill those weeds :) This stuff worked quickly too....I'm talking within a week there was a HUGE difference. This will not replace Tenacity for me because I will still use Tenacity for new and/or overseeding. Otherwise, this may be my go to established lawn weed killer during hot months.
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Willis

customer_reviews.title: Best weed killer ever!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this product 10 stars I would! I have tried several other brands of weed killer and have not had one till now be able to kill a certain weed type that has started growing all around my property due to wind blowing seeds from nearby equestrian area field. This product literally worked within hours and by next morning everything I sprayed was dead and or mostly dead already. Other products barely dried out the weeds after multiple treatments, this product I barely applied once and it began working within hours.
customer_reviews.author: Mike L

customer_reviews.title: This Product Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I have tried to use this product several times. Even a a very high dose (with spreader-sticker added) it did nothing to clover, dandelions and other weeds. I applied it with a garden sprayer directly to the weeds and saturated it - still afer 7 days no effect.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Ranieri

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. Saw small results within hours. My lawn was full of weeds because I did not put down pre-emergent. Within 24 hours most weeds began to shrivel up and die. The remaining days all were gone. Highly recommend. Remember to wear protective stuff such as long sleeves, pants, boots. This stuff is strong so protect yourself. Also if you have pets or children make sure they avoid the area when spraying and after for some time.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Very effective
customer_reviews.text: I mixed 50ml (2 oz) into 1.5 gal of water w/ a dollop of dishwashing liquid soap in my sprayer and just walked around hitting the yard. Put a little extra focus on the weeds I could see, but gave everything an even coat. Within about 4 days the dandelions, clover and some large leaf things I couldn't ID were all having a bad day. Not sure if I have the optimum mix, but figured my experience would give folks an idea of where to start. Good stuff!!
customer_reviews.author: Twins Mom

customer_reviews.title: Did the trick at a reasonable cost
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research trying to find an answer to the plantain taking over my backyard. Appropriately mixed, including adding dish washing detergent, really did the trick. However, you'll need to do multiple treatments to get a major infestation under control. I used it weekly for about a month. I'll need to buy more for next summer, and jump on the weeds when they first emerge. Although the product is a bit pricey, it was a fraction of what landscapers charged for just one treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Tennessee Tony

customer_reviews.title: Weed Killer, Surfactant and 1 gallon sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I live in the northeast area and my lawn had some issues with clover, some weeds that grew on vines and creeping charlie. Clover were killed in a few days. the creeping charlie I had to apply a 2nd time to do the job. Sprayed in on some crabgrass but didnt really do anything to that particular weed.
customer_reviews.author: cayman

customer_reviews.title: Took care of my weeds
customer_reviews.text: Eradicated the weeds in my yard. I let them grow for a couple weeks to grow to be easy targets and sprayed them with this stuff. A few days later after I enjoyed watching the weeds twist and shrivel I mowed them all down. Now, over a month later, a few new weeds have popped up, but it isn’t anywhere near as bad as it used to be! I believe every leafy weed I effectively sprayed died. Note: It doesn’t appear to effect grassy weeds which makes sense.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Augustine Schmit

customer_reviews.title: Killed my lawn
customer_reviews.text: This killed my lawn. I mixed it exactly as instructed and read all the reviews and my grass died. The weeds look fine, though. 😥
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Z

customer_reviews.title: Really works !!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this in a couple of spots just to see if it works. It's great. No weeds and didn't kill the grass. I plan to use the whole bottle on the spots that have weeds in my yard instead of paying exorbitant amount for someone else to do it. Not necessary to use on spots that don't have weeds. It took 2-3 days, but will work better now that the rain has ceased for a while. I used a $4 sprayer that I got from Wal Mart. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Norma Austin

customer_reviews.title: User four 5 years, 1 application every spring.
customer_reviews.text: It just plain works and economical. I use this every spring 2oz per gallon in a 4 gallon backpack sprayer on a acre and a half Texas country lawn. Add a bit of dish soap for the cling effect. I wait until post emerging weeds and can not take it anymore looking at my yard. Within 2 weeks all gone. I am surrounded by 20 acres of pasture and thru the years this is all that will work. Be patient and give it time to work. You will not be disappointed, unless you applied it wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Has Not Worked On Dandelions
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product 4 times in the last 6 weeks to spot treat dandelions in my pasture and lawn. I am using 3-4 Tbsp/gallon. I also added a surfactant (liquid soap) for treatments 3 and 4. I have used similar products with the same active ingredient in the past successfully. I don’t know what the issue could be other than a dilution problem on their end. Dandelions start to wilt in 5 days or so, and then recover and are happy to go to seed. There has been no rain in my area during this treatment time. I don’t know what the issue could be, but I cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Kills Lespedeza
customer_reviews.text: lespedeza is an awful tenacious weed in my yard. All the local big box store weed killers did nothing to control this weed. I was hoping for a miracle. Well, this product delivered. I had sprayed it on the weeds and saw nothing for a week. I thought this would be another failure. Today however, I did a lawn check and to my wonder all the lespedeza was turning yellow! Not only that but the equally hard to kill lawn violets were also dying. A twofer! This product is expensive but, if you really want to control lespedeza and lawn violets this is your product. Was worried it would harm the turf grass but no, the grass is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome P. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff, but...
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot about this product before finally buying it to kill off spurweed/stickers in my yard, but mixing instructions are very vague and took some experimenting before finally working. My first spread was too diluted and no weeds were killed. The second dosage about 2 weeks later did the job, but also killed some patches of St. Augustine and Bermuda Grass that still hasn't recovered over a month later. I also sprayed some variegated ivy at the same time that has overtaken the back part of my property with no result. It can be difficult to mix properly, but definitely kills off spurweed.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Not for St Augustine or Centipede grass
customer_reviews.text: I have previously used Ortho Weed b Gon for Southern lawns. I was looking for a replacement and came across this. I was misled by the company name "Southern" thinking it was for Southern lawns (my mistake). It will surely harm your southern lawn. I won't downgrade this product because of my mistake. I just want to warn others to be aware this product may not be what you want.
customer_reviews.author: Just JimTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: It really works and it works fast, but beware it will kill everything
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was supposed to spare my bermuda grass from permanent death while killing off the carpetgrass and crabgrass. It is REALLY effective on the crabgrass and carpetgrass. They turn brown and die quickly, but the bermuda died along with them. It totally eradicated the crabgrass, I have not seen any even try to come back. Some of the carpetgrass tried to come back, but was easy to pull up when it started sprouting. My only complaint is the bermuda died where I sprayed also and now I am having to wait on it to spread over the brown patches.
customer_reviews.author: Wray Rives

customer_reviews.title: No mix instructions included. Do not buy!!
customer_reviews.text: There are no instructions on how to mix with water. I tried to use other reviewers suggestions; but left my lawn with big brown spots where both grass and weeds were killed. It is inexcusable to not give clear mixing instruction in the pages of cautions and warning included. I would not recommend anyone buy this stuff until they fix that. It is dangerus to not have precise mix ratios
customer_reviews.author: Dick J

customer_reviews.title: Did not kill weeds
customer_reviews.text: i tested a 10'x10' section of my yard, the most weeded area. i mixed per instructions, a little less than 1/4 cup per gallon of water in a 1.25 gallon sprayer, applied about 1/4 gallon to yard, and no change after 10 days. i added 1/4 cup of weed killer and topped off water, applied again, and weeds and GRASS killed. i will use the rest of the product to kill weeds/grass on patio bricks but never on my yard. great grass killer.
customer_reviews.author: michael spada

customer_reviews.title: The instructions and directions for dosage to mix with water are terrible
customer_reviews.text: I have applied the product, but a few things that were a nightmare on this. The label is not clear on many things: - you have to wait 30 days before seeding. Most of the weeds are anuals, so I don’t recommend using this product during the fall - the weeds will die anyway, focus on getting your soil strong and overseeding - the ratio for water for dilution is not clear. I ended up using a spoon per gallon, with the hope that this will work but was based on what people were saying vs the label directions
customer_reviews.author: Walter Gandra

customer_reviews.title: Great value - works well.
customer_reviews.text: Great weed/grass killer. Right up there with Roundup at half the price. Does often take two applications on stubborn grass but that's pretty normal. Takes a week or two to turn the weeds/grass yellow and they eventually die. This isn't the product for you if you want to see immediate results.
customer_reviews.author: MrBCaShopper

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Be patient and let it work it’s magic. I mixed 3tbs in a 1 gallon tank sprayer along with 1 tbsp of liquid Dawn. I have new Bermuda grass sod that is 3 months old but weeds were sprouting up everywhere. It’s been 5 days and starting to see them wilt away. Will treat again n a couple weeks to knock out any new or stubborn ones.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: It works but with mixed results
customer_reviews.text: Used this stuff to wipe out an abundant amount of creeping charlie in my yard. 4 ounces for 2 gallons. Shady areas take 3 days longer to wilt. Sunny areas begin to clear 1 day after application. The whole process takes 2 weeks. So far it's had no ill effects on what grass existed within the weedy areas. This includes crab grass. It does not seem to clear crab grass, or ivy for that matter. Overall, it seems to be effective, although in the future I think I'll be using Tenacity for environmental reasons.
customer_reviews.author: HappyBigSun

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great !
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. I see a lot of people said they had to wait 2 weeks. It only took a few days to start seeing the difference. Powerful stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: My weeds have developed a resistance to herbicides.
customer_reviews.text: Went from the recommended dosage to 2x, 3x and will try full strength next week. At 1 or 2x - might as well be watering weeds. At 3x the recommended dose, some weeds are yellowing and hopefully will die. I will try full strength after my next mowing - maybe the results will be better. But so far, I'm not impressed. The only positive is that it is selective and doesn't kill grass... or maybe it is so weak that it doesn't kill anything.
customer_reviews.author: LAP99

customer_reviews.title: Yeah splurge is dying
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Scott’s one gallon sprayer and measured two fl ounces in it along with blue dye so I could see what I was spraying. I sprayed it yesterday and it was a delight to see all the splurge starting to shrivel up and DIE! I ended up spot spraying two gallons! Watching all wither away has made me smile. How to by Doc recommended this product. It works! Alabama
customer_reviews.author: Steve Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: A whole bottle of plant murder.
customer_reviews.text: I expected it to take a few days to see results, but everything was 80% dead after 24 hours. It is really hot and dry in the Phoenix sun, so maybe that helped it along. The directions are for large scale use. I ended up with a roughly 1:10 mix after giving up trying to figure out how many pints cover a square furlong or some-such. Either way, 10/10. P.S. Not for use on laundry.
customer_reviews.author: K. Ward

customer_reviews.title: This Really Works
customer_reviews.text: This stuff really works! I had some unidentifiable, broad leaf, underground runner type weed which was impervious to other broad leaf herbicides. The weed was becoming the new ground cover no matter how much it was thinned. One application of this weed killer and in one week all that was left was dried up and swiveled.
customer_reviews.author: Kim L

customer_reviews.title: Beat a lawn service
customer_reviews.text: Had a real bad weed problem with the new house we bought. Mixed 1.5oz per gallon in a pressure sprayer and spot treated the lawn. Weeds started to die within a few days. Applied a second application and they were gone. Bought some for my son and he had the same results. This stuff will last several year if stored properly and beat the cost of a lawn service by hundreds of dollars. I even had some left over in the sprayer and let my neighbor use it up and they loved the results.
customer_reviews.author: works hard for his money

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: i used it once this year about 2 weeks ago at temperature of 60-70F, and now i can see the weeds are fading away. i mainly have the poa annua and dallas grass. i used it with ortho dial and spray since my lawn was about 10,000sqft, setting at 1.5/gal, at this rate i poured down about little less than 1/3 of the bottle. i plan to do this once again 2 weeks from now and report back.
customer_reviews.author: squid wagner

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says. I sprayed one day and the next day weeds were wilting. The second day they turned brown. It really works. I used 1.5 oz per gallon and seems to do the trick. A applied it with a Northern 21 gal tow behind boom sprayer and it worked great. It didn't harm my grass, it did wilt some leaves on one of my small willow trees but it seems on now. Just be careful around small trees and other plants. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful
customer_reviews.text: Thee is a fine line between killing the weeds and killing the lawn. I used 1oz per gallon and it was too strong in some places. Also be sure to turn of irrigation for a day or it does nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Graham

customer_reviews.title: Active ingredient is 46.8%, quite high!
customer_reviews.text: OMG, you folks REALLY need to list the concentration of the active ingredient (46.8%) and NOT in lbs/per gallon (NO ONE DOES THAT). For instance, you sell another product that is a gallon for $25 which looks way cheaper, but then you find its only 11%. So in reality it's way more expensive!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Started Working In 24 Hours
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a new house, and the lawn is covered with weeds. In the past, I've used Image with great success, but decided to give this a try. Just 24 hours later, and I'm starting to see results. The weeds are definitely curling up and starting to brown. Mind you, these are the weeds that are growing around my shrubs, and not in the grass. Perhaps those weeds will take a little longer to kill, but so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Jazzyme

customer_reviews.title: Kills poison ivy, brush, chickweed, creeping bermuda grass (for now)
customer_reviews.text: This worked pretty quick! I've tried to kill some brush and poison ivy, as well as some kind of trees that keep popping up though my landscape and this stuff works!! So far so good. A little pricey and I hope I don't develop cancer or anything from it, but it works! I am positive I will have to spray it several times to get it completely gone.. but this is a a great start! I actually noticed the browning of the leaves began within 24 hours. Much quicker than other products I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: akhopper11

customer_reviews.title: Works on buttercups
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely don't like chemicals but resorted to this herbicide to deal with a good 1/4 care of buttercups in my pasture. I used 2 springs. With 2 applications the first year and 1 this year. The number of butter cup plants is a fraction of what I started with. Spray on a sunny morning before plants flower. I pretty much did the worst area and then spot treated the rest. Kept horses off pasture for a few days.
customer_reviews.author: lurline

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works awesome on that creeping charlie, the only thing i found that works on it.
customer_reviews.author: greg

customer_reviews.title: Good weed killer
customer_reviews.text: Used it in a one gallon sprayer with 9 capfuls to come close to 3 Tablespoons plus a drop or two of Dawn detergent. Within 2 days I noticed The weeds starting to pucker. In about 4 days I noticed the yellow discoloration. I did apply it a day after cutting on one lawn and same day on another. It did not kill the grass (tall fescue or zoysia). I wash my hands vigorously after using this and probably should use gloves. I am a week into this so I’m not sure if dead means dead or will the weeds come back. Most prevalent weed in my yard is wild violet.
customer_reviews.author: Jeddyo

customer_reviews.title: Weedkiller
customer_reviews.text: Kills weeds without killing my Bermuda grass. Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: TERRY T BROWN

customer_reviews.title: It works better than anything I have used to kill weeds!
customer_reviews.text: This is simply the best for weed killing! As others have stated use with a couple drops of dawn for best results. Amazing results using 2 Tbls. per gallon. Roundup should be taken off the market immediately and the makers sued for death of all life forms! We have been deceived by these criminal chemical manufacturers and it is time to return to what worked before their deceptions!
customer_reviews.author: howlinwolf

customer_reviews.title: had star of bethlehem problem in my lawn
customer_reviews.text: had star of Bethlehem problem in my lawn, some say its a flower, but to my lawn it looks like a weed to me. this fixed the problem. used a hand can to put it down
customer_reviews.author: Army Guy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: At first I got excited. After day one some of the weeds appeared to be wilting, by day two some of the weeds would have some yellow spots on them. After 2 weeks, weeds are still there, just look like they have burn spots. Have tried an extra 2 to 3 applications on the problem-some weeds and it is still not working. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: kel78

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I had used this product (smaller size) before and had not submitted the feedback. It had worked very nicely. YOu have to use it exactly as described to see the results but it really produces good results.
customer_reviews.author: Ashi

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good weed killer.
customer_reviews.text: Applied once so far earlier this summer. Knocked down a lot of the broad leaf weeds. Did not do much for my clover problem. Next application I am going to buy some marking fluid so I can better monitor the application.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Knaup

customer_reviews.title: Following the instructions may not give you the results that you expect.
customer_reviews.text: I believe I got a bad batch. I originally mixed 3 tbsp with one gallon of water. The results were not impressive. Weeds started to wilt but soon recovered. I tried three different times on different test spots, including one trial with a squirt of baby shampoo. Results varied from poor to not great but its only been a week since the secondary testing occurred.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Willms

customer_reviews.title: great stuff kills blackberry and italian urahm.Works on broad leaf plants
customer_reviews.text: it takes its sweet time 3 to 6 weeks or so but it succeeds where roundup fails. kills oak trees. Use caution to not get it on you and watch out for wind drift. smell is strong to warn you.
customer_reviews.author: MR G

customer_reviews.title: I sprayed it as directed. After over a week ...
customer_reviews.text: I sprayed it as directed. After over a week and no results, i sprayed it again. I just did not receive the results as the other people who purchased this product
customer_reviews.author: Mark A McDowell

customer_reviews.title: Works but
customer_reviews.text: This worked quickly for me; however, it did also affect the grass around the weeds. I have a bunch of brown spots on my lawn now. It's Bermuda grass so it'll bounce back, but you should be aware that if you're spraying around your lawn, it'll temporarily brown the grass around it too.
customer_reviews.author: David Champagne

customer_reviews.title: Does just what it says and the price is right.
customer_reviews.text: I have a garden bed with trailing indigo, fairy dusters and other shrubs which was being invaded by broad leaf weeds. I sprayed the bed with this weed killer and now the broad leaf weeds are gone without killing the other plants. The plants that were not effected by this weed killer all had woody stems but I could not selectively spray due to the denseness of the plantings.
customer_reviews.author: Bill in Tucson

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product! It actually only killed my weed and left the grass unharmed! I sprayed it on Saturday morning and mowed my lawn Sunday afternoon which I should have not done. However, the weed is still dying 7 days after. Works fast and I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Omer Viveros

customer_reviews.title: The product does not kill creeping  charlie
customer_reviews.text: When I received the product and opened the container, it smelled very toxic. I knew right away that I did not want to use something that would contaminate my body. As I inquired further, I learned that the product's volume was greater than what I needed for my yard and would require testing of the spraying speed of my 1 gallon sprayer. I then knew I was thinking correctly, that I needed a professional lawn treatment person to treat my lawn with a 2-4 D herbacide. I also need to have dicamba in the herbacide's mixture so it kills creeping charlie (ground ivy). That requirement was a big reason I should not keep your product.
customer_reviews.author: Emily J. Willis

customer_reviews.title: So so product
customer_reviews.text: I honestly don't know with this weed killer. I had really high hopes. I live in NC and have Bermuda grass and get SO MANY weeds. I've tried weed and feed, pulling the weeds, etc etc. This stuff does eventually kill some weeds, but by the time it kills some, way more have popped up.
customer_reviews.author: Dallin & Heather

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product! Kills all weeds, not grass
customer_reviews.text: This is really great stuff. Killed all my weeds, didn't harm grass. If you manage to kill your grass with it, then you have a weedy grass. Did NOT kill my Bermuda grass either.
customer_reviews.author: durtynacho

customer_reviews.title: Works great, not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Pro: works perfectly. Killed all my dandilions and not my grass Con: its all just concentrate. Theres no method of using it. It takes some time to set in and work but its great. I highly reccomend buying one of those sprayers that attaches to the hose and filling it up with this stuff. It will make this the perfect product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Tessaro

customer_reviews.title: We had a yard full of dandelions. Within a ...
customer_reviews.text: We had a yard full of dandelions. Within a week of putting this stuff out, everything was gone. Lawn wasn't impacted at all except in the spots where it was mostly weeds.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Poland

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work killing dandelions and other in AZ lawn even at double rec'd stregth.
customer_reviews.text: Initially tried the rec'd strength. Waited 4 wks, and didn't do a thing. Reapplied at double strength, again w/o any benefit. And the product requires mask, gloves, immediate washing of clothes after using. A lot of hassle for a product that didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: CPR

customer_reviews.title: Good God did it work fast
customer_reviews.text: Boy did this stuff kill all of the weeds in my yard in about a month. My backyard was literally all weeds as I got a late start this season. Ordered this stuff and a pump sprayer and treated it once. "A watched pot never boils" and I didn't realize until yesterday when I mowed the lawn that all of the weeds were gone. Good God did it work fast.
customer_reviews.author: Teirynf

customer_reviews.title: Avoid.
customer_reviews.text: I waited two weeks and it didn’t kill any weeds. Combined with surfactant and lazer blue for marking purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kills creeping buttercup!
customer_reviews.text: Kind of expensive, but worth it! This product works as advertised. Our backyard was crawling with ground ivy, and looked terrible! He sprayed this and within 2 weeks all the ivy died and slowly disappeared. We used a pump sprayer and it took a while, but very happy with the results
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Helps turn the lawn green.
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to try to improve the health of my lawn. Found it on YouTube. I goes pretty far when you mix it. I would say I have had mixed results so far, but I will continue to increase the amount of water on use and will be updating this review.
customer_reviews.author: D,.L  Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Doesn't kill zoysia if mixed correctly..
customer_reviews.text: Finally a relief from Dandelions! Took about three weeks but didn't hurt my Amazoy Zoysia turf at all. Make sure it's mixed properly. Was deadly to the dreaded "D"'s..
customer_reviews.author: BChandler

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd gallon of purchased in the last 90 days this one went to my mother for her farm. this works amazing. Allowed two weeks and then you've got scorched Earth. Break it up after 3, to be safe, throw some grass seed down and you're good to go. But seriously, ignore the label on planting, nothing will grow there for 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L. Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Works quickly!
customer_reviews.text: Just sprayed, and within 24 hours, I am seeing affected plants curling and dying! It is wonderful to use. Just be smart about handling it. Protective gloves, goggles, long pants and shirt. Make sure you wash those clothes separate. I used in a 1 gallon sprayer. According to label, 2 OZ was all i needed. It works great!
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Order 2
customer_reviews.text: You have to mix it up on your own, and yell at your toddler not to follow you thru the yard. Other than that it was fun watching some stubborn weeds die and the grass fill in. Of course this allowed another weed to pop up and start to run rampant. I will probably be retreating before the summer is out.
customer_reviews.author: bkate

customer_reviews.title: kills the weeds not the grass
customer_reviews.text: I covered a 3 acre area with an atv sprayer it was 1/3 weed,results were noticeable within days total kill in two weeks some weeds died faster than other reseeded after two weeks results were awesome looks like a golf coarse now love this stuff
customer_reviews.author: luke w.

customer_reviews.title: TOO SLOW WORKING AND NOT AS EFFECTIVE AS EXPECTED
customer_reviews.text: I SPRAYED THIS ACCORDING TO INSTRUCTIONS AND REAPPLIED AGAIN 5 DAYS LATER. WEEDS DID NOT EVEN TURN BROWN AND CONTINUED TO GROW. SO DISAPPOINTED. I AM ORDERING ANOTHER BRAND TO GET RID OF THE WEEDS BEFORE STARTING MY SPRING GARDEN.
customer_reviews.author: donya8

customer_reviews.title: Day 1.... so far so good
customer_reviews.text: I sprayed this on some creeping Charlie yesterday and it’s starting to yellow and wilt. All my grass seems fine. I’m excited to see if it can help kill the poke weed that popped up by my fence too
customer_reviews.author: aimee

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work on cool season grass and most weeds
customer_reviews.text: It works I’ve been looking at this product for a year now and decided to buy. It works on certain types of weeds crabgrass, dandelions, some clover, it’s not a complete clover killer. I did some spot sprays in my lawn and it works without killing the grass. I have tall fescue, bluegrass, rye mix. I read that there is no directions on how much you need and it was hard to find I hate reading too! But it says in tiny print that 1 oz for every 1 gallon and that does work plus you need to mix it with a surfactant as well in a gallon or more sprayer to get the best results.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Kizer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Love this, it’s killed all the grass growing in my driveway. I Just Wish the directions explained better the ratio of chemical versus water. However once I looked it up online everything was easy after that. I will purchase this again
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Best weed killer I've ever bought... won't buy anything else!
customer_reviews.text: This works awesome! Mix it to the instructions and you CAN'T GO WRONG! Tip: by a die to add to it so you know where you've sprayed.
customer_reviews.author: NicMon

customer_reviews.title: Fast acting
customer_reviews.text: Works well on some weeds. Did start to kill in a couple of days. Overall satisfied just wish it would kill all the weeds I have in my lawn. Unfortunately have to buy another product to kill the other weeds.
customer_reviews.author: Jacks

customer_reviews.title: Awesome results - Residential MN Lawn
customer_reviews.text: I have a residential lawn in MN and this product worked incredibly well for spot treatment of common lawn weeds (creeping charlie, clover, and dandelions were my primary targets). I found the best mix to be 3 tablespoons of 2,4-d Weed Killer in a 1 gallon pump sprayer. This is 2-3 times more than the provided instructions suggested, but it caused no damage to grass and showed great results in only 1 week. I avoided watering for 48hrs from application, but let my normal irrigation schedule resume after 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Make sure to do the proper ratio for the sprayer you have. Make sure it’s not windy and that you are sure you are careful as to what you spray. This took about 14-21 days fully work. Be patient
customer_reviews.author: victor sanders

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this stuff is awesome! I will never fo back to the ortho stuff again
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Matt

customer_reviews.title: Probably good for weeds other than Crepe Myrtle pop ups
customer_reviews.text: Someone answered my question that this would kill my crepe myrtle pop ups. It killed them (on the surface) along with the grass around them (even though I was careful). I have a new crop of pop ups that will likely require napalm to kill.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

product_meta.title: Southern Ag Amine 24-D Weed Killer, White Bottle
product_meta.description:
Size:32oz - Quart• Low, economical use rate of 1 to 4 pints per acre

• Controls many broadleaf weeds & woody plants

• Use in turf, pastures, rangeland, ditch banks, fences…

CONTAINS: 3.8 lbs. per gallon 2, 4-D acid

equivalent liquid concentrate in a low volatile

amine form.

USE ON: Certain grasses in lawns, parks,

golf courses, and pastures; fences, ditch

banks, non-crop sites, small grains, and

corn (pre and post emergent herbicide)

CONTROLS: Many broad-leaf weeds.

See list on label.
feature_bullets: For use in pastures & rangeland, lawns, golf courses, cemeteries, parks,& similar ornamental turf.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,694 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
